title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define project scope, objectives, and requirements. Gather input from stakeholders and end-users to understand their needs and expectations.

title: System Architecture Design
description: Design the overall system architecture, including backend, frontend, data storage components, communication and integration mechanisms. Address scalability, fault tolerance, and security considerations for a real-time user experience monitoring system that correlates backend performance metrics with frontend user interactions and sentiment analysis. Provide a detailed diagram and documentation explaining the different components, their responsibilities, and how they interact with each other. Include details on the chosen technologies and why, considering the project's requirements and constraints. This RFC is in DRAFT state and requires review and comments from the assigned team members.

title: Backend Development
description: Implement the backend components responsible for collecting and processing performance metrics, handling data storage, and exposing APIs for frontend integration.

title: Frontend Development
description: Develop the frontend user interface and experience, including user interaction tracking, performance monitoring, and sentiment analysis integration.

title: Data Storage and Management for UserExperienceMonitor Project
description: Design and implement a scalable, reliable, and efficient data storage solution. This includes performance metrics, user interactions, and sentiment analysis data. The solution should support real-time querying and data retrieval. Consider using a hybrid database system (e.g., combining NoSQL for unstructured data like user interactions and SQL for structured data like performance metrics). To handle the different data types and workloads, consider sharding or partitioning the data based on the specific requirements of each component. Ensure data redundancy, backup, and disaster recovery mechanisms are in place, including periodic snapshots and asynchronous replication. Additionally, explore potential integration with a time-series database for handling high-velocity time-stamped data. However, it is recommended to also investigate other relevant databases such as Cassandra or Redis for specific use cases (e.g., real-time processing). Update the solution design to clearly outline how this will be achieved, including a comparison of various options and justifications for the chosen approach. Mention the potential trade-offs in terms of performance, cost, and maintainability. Once the design is finalized, initiate the implementation phase with the appropriate team members (e.g., backend-developer). After completion of the implementation, validate the solution through testing and quality assurance procedures.

title: Integration and Testing
description: Integrate the backend, frontend, and data storage components. Perform comprehensive testing, including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests.

title: Security and Compliance
description: Ensure the system adheres to security best practices and complies with relevant regulations, such as data privacy laws and industry standards.

title: Deployment and Monitoring
description: Deploy the UserExperienceMonitor system to production environments, set up monitoring and logging mechanisms, and establish processes for ongoing maintenance and updates.

title: Documentation and Training
description: Create comprehensive documentation for the UserExperienceMonitor system, including user guides, technical documentation, and training materials for stakeholders and end-users.
